Reviews.Author: Mark P.
Reviews.Content: We sat in the bar area on a Saturday night. It was crowded but that's what you're looking for and expect. Most of the people in the bar area were Spanish, which is a good sign. Everything was very good, but didn't quite wow me enough for five stars. Would go back.

Reviews.Author: Erika S.
Reviews.Content: I've been going there off and on for 7 years now and I have noticed a decline in quality since its expansion. This seems quite common in restaurants; they become successful and then rely on their image rather than their food to sustain them. I'm not sure what it is exactly. Perhaps it's a change in ingredients. I don't know. I've also lived in Spain and some of the dishes don't really live up to their name here. The paella is ok, for example. I will have to say, however, that the goat cheese and pincho de pollo are excellent. Also, the hostess was incredibly rude to me last time and that left a bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Author: Emre C.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is super! It's close to my university, Roosevelt. All students at Roosevelt should go there. It's good place for drinks and food. They have appetizer like food, but they give lots, like Turkish meze. But, don't go upstairs the new restaurant is not so good, downstairs is more better.

Reviews.Author: Lauren B.
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable. Recommend the baked goat cheese in tomato sauce, mushrooms, squid, and seafood paella....Attentive wait staff and food was brought out very fast!

Reviews.Author: Emily C.
Reviews.Content: By far the BEST Tapas in Chicago! SO authentic.  After having lived in Spain, Iberico makes you feel like you are there..  Sangria, Croquetas, pisto, y tortilla, por favor!  Only con is that there can be really long waits, and no reservations last time I checked... But then again, that's pretty authentic too!

Reviews.Author: L V.
Reviews.Content: The sangria is great. The paella we had was wonderful also. We had several selections of tapas and we liked everything we had. It was a bit noisy, so maybe not the best for a quiet evening. But very lively for group dinners.

Reviews.Author: Acnalb M.
Reviews.Content: Delicious authentic Spanish tapas. My mom is from Madrid, and loves going here whenever she is in town. I recommend the Spanish tortilla, Morcilla, Gambas al ajillo, and be the Sangria is delicious.

Reviews.Author: Julie C.
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at how much food they give per plate. I'm so used to ordering 8-10 plates when I go for tapas but the kind waiter stopped us after four saying it was going to be too much (for two people). He was so right. All of the dishes were great, but I definitely recommend the red wine sangria and the paella iberica. Overall, perfect.

Reviews.Author: Shajan K.
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Cafe Iberico for about 12 years and always have had a good experience. The ambiance and food are great. The red sangria has lost its flare over the years, but still good. IBERICO FAVs: PATATAS ALI-OLI (GARLIC POTATOES), SALPICON DE MARISCO (SEAFOOD SALAD), PINCHO DE SOLOMILLO (BEEF SKEWERS), QUESO DE CABRA (GOAT CHEESE WITH MARINARA SAUCE), GAMBAS AL AJILLO (GARLIC SHRIMP) and MEJILLONES A LA MARINERA (MUSSELS). I will say the only thing that I don't like about the restaurant is the inability to make reservations especially when you have larger parties.

Reviews.Author: Fahad A.
Reviews.Content: Really good food. But really crowded and LOUD.

Reviews.Author: Erin M.
Reviews.Content: I used to be a die-hard fan of Iberico. I pretty much refused to eat tapas anywhere else because Iberico was always better. WAS. I am so saddened by how much the quality of their food has gone downhill in the last year or two. I used to love the queso de cabra (goat cheese in tomato), the pulpa (octopus), the patatas bravas or ali oli. And the quality of all have appreciably declined. It pains me to say it, but I wont be visiting Iberico anymore.

Reviews.Author: Dave M.
Reviews.Content: I have been here a few times and every time I go I have a good experience.  It takes a long time to be seated on weekends but its worth it.  Their sangria is good and not to expensive especially if you buy a small pitcher rather than by the glass.  Tapas places are always fun to go to because you get to try so many different dishes.  Food comes out very fast after you order and is very good.

Reviews.Author: Rose C.
Reviews.Content: Just had lunch with 60 people at Cafe Iberico-- the food was terrific and the service fantastic.  We had 9 different things from a package menu and 4 different desserts-- I had favorites (the seafood salad and the pulpo-- oh and the garlic potato salad) but every dish was delicious.  I think no one will eat for the next week, and still there was food left over to take home.  Lots of the people there had never had tapas, so that was fun for them, and another large group were Spanish or had lived in Spain-- everyone was equally delighted with the food.  I can't thank the chef's, servers and manager enough, it was seamless. A wonderful, really fun, experience, and I would gladly go to another event at Cafe Iberico.

Reviews.Author: Gaurav M.
Reviews.Content: Good food and ambience.

Reviews.Author: Razzina z.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite low key places in Chicago.  I always go there for a start of girls night out . Very reasonably priced, great food, great Sangria !!!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany G.
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st tapas restaurant and I enjoyed so much I went back several times and visited a few others. The ambiance in the restaurant is dark and although I'm sure it's meant to be romantic or set a tone, it just comes off as dark. You can't really be that romantic in such a large crowded restaurant. I've gone several times and enjoyed the food on all occasions. We had a beef tip tapas with carmelized onions, garlic potatoes and beef with goat cheese. The meat was cooked to perfection and everything was seasoned well. I must admit that every time I've gone to this restaurant it's been packed to capacity and it's a long wait. While this is great for buisness it can be a bother for patrons attempting to grab a quick bite. If you go to this restaurant on the weekend you should definitely expect to be seated no  sooner than 45 minutes after arriving.

Reviews.Author: Jon R.
Reviews.Content: wide tapas selection & cold beers. the joint is packed on fridays and saturdays, so expect the noise level to be high. parking could be challenging too!

Reviews.Author: Yolanda D.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Even though the last time I went the server was less than stellar.  The sangria's are great! The mussels are AMAZING! I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Jessica P.
Reviews.Content: meh. Tapas Valencia or ba ba reba are much better! don't waste your time or money. Both of my other tapas restaurant that I recommend are better and cheaper. We gladly gave our leftovers to a homeless man.  I'm just saying. And after going to Spain, we have recognized the very obvious differences. Just because Cafe Ib-gross was in a trendy neighborhood, does not mean it is any good. but...good service...so pay for that!

Reviews.Author: Evan M.
Reviews.Content: Horrible service.  They don't care about satisfying customers anymore because they have so many, so the servers are horrible.

Reviews.Author: Arthur O.
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible experience just waiting for a table yesterday, August 17th. One of the front hostesses was rude to me within 5 minutes of my arrival. I let them know that they have lost my business not only now but in the future. I went to Cafe Ba Ba Ree Ba instead and had a wonderful meal along with wonderful service.

Reviews.Author: Tim K.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the places I always visit when I'm in Chicago. It had been a few years since my last visit and they have changed some things. There is now an actual tapas bar in the front of the restaurant where patrons can select the number of their item and have it delivered to the table. Meanwhile you still get a menu and can order items off the menu as well. I went with a group of four and two went to the front to order while I ordered items off the menu. Needless to say we got a few too many items. That would be a bad thing if everything was not out of this world delicious. Hands down the best items we ordered were the pulpo a la plancha (grilled octopus), fried mussels served on a half shell, the tortilla espanola and the garlic potatoes. We ordered too many items to list here but there was not a dud with any of them. Washed it all down with pitchers of white and red sangria. Total came to $40 per person with generous tip. Highly recommend and definitely will be back next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: mike s.
Reviews.Content: Food is good.... great value... cheap and tasty sangria pitchers.... enjoyed the scallops. Interior/ atmosphere is just ok.

Reviews.Author: kristi p.
Reviews.Content: best sangria i've ever had!  food is delicious. get ready to pig out!  atmosphere is funky cool. plenty of cold and hot tapas to choose from. go there and let your hair down. party! party! party!

Reviews.Author: Henry F.
Reviews.Content: WAY THE HELL TOO NOISY!  My wife and I have been to Iberico several times over several years and visited recently on a weekend night with two relatives from abroad.  Their tapas and the prices were both OK, but I'd forgotten or finally appreciated what a horribly noisy place this can be.  We were first seated in their northerly room well before it was full, could not converse with one another due to the loud, young customers blabbing over the overly loud Flamenco music and asked to be moved.  We wound up in the southerly room (downstairs, as I recall) and, as it filled, it became noisier than the other.  The whole joint had nothing but the hardest of surfaces, tile floors, etc., and not an ounce of sound-absorptive materials.  Our entire evening was spent yelling at one another, gesturing and asking for repeats.   It must be the loudest restaurant in Chicago.  Avoid this poorly planned hellhole if you value your hearing.

Reviews.Author: M R.
Reviews.Content: been here a few times.  great food, great atmosphere

Reviews.Author: Kara M.
Reviews.Content: you know how you go to tapas places and people just start ordering and you kind of have no idea what the hell you're eating because you're like 3 glasses into the sangria and plates are flying by you at the speed of light...yeah so that's how cafe iberico was for me. however i do remember a goat cheese and toasted bread dish, some potatoes in a red sauce, chicken skewers, and a pear dish and that they were pretty good. i'm one of those people who likes tapas but have a fave place to which no other tapas spot can hold a light to ( PAZO IN BALTIMORE!). the food was good but there was no dish that completely wowed me which i had hoped for when we picked this place. i have to say that the service was great and the waiter was attentive as we were ordering quickly and often. i thought the prices weren't too bad and there was a good serving of food with each plate. this place is a def 3.5...dammit yelp for not having a half star...sheesh!

Reviews.Author: CE C.
Reviews.Content: I think one of the reasons I love this place is for nostalgic reasons.  I first went to this restaurant about 10 years ago, and loved it than, and keeping coming back everytime i visit chicago.  Its also so impressive how well they have done for themselves and the expansion that occurred with this place.  Even when tapas are so popular now which means more expensive, they still only charge $4 for a glass of sangria!  For dinner we had the tortilla espanola, croquetas de pollo, jamon iberico which were excellent, probably the best parts of the meal.  They just do the simple stuff so well, nothing fancy about it, just basic spanish tapas, no crazy spin on it.  The seafood salad was also excellent, not fishy smelling at all!  Also had the pincho de solomillo which we could have done without, yes the meat was tender, however the fries were absolutely unnecessary and tasted like they have been sitting out for days!  The grilled calamari and stuffed chipirones served in squid ink was also delicious.  The baked goat cheese....The gambas al ajillo were not garlicky enough!  Lastly we had the paella iberico, which was disappointing.  Although they say it takes 40 mins to cook, where was that crusty rice bottom?!  Nevertheless, we will return next time we are in chicago!

Reviews.Author: M R.
Reviews.Content: authentic tapas from espana are challenging to find in the states.  what made my night fun here was our food, great service & reasonably priced tapas.  i heart cafe iberico...lo siento...me gusta cafe iberico~

Reviews.Author: R E.
Reviews.Content: When it comes to my favorite Tapas place in ALL of chicago, Cafe Iberico is the place!  I've been coming here for years and it has never let me down.  The place gets very crowded and although bumping up against other people can be a little uncomfortable at times, it is worth the wait in my opinion.  I wouldn't recommend coming if you're starving and want to be seated quickly.  Come here knowing that you'll have to wait possibly 30-40 minutes and during that time relax and enjoy their Sangria!  The food is delicious, and reasonably priced in comparison to any other Tapas restaurants!  The service has always been great and I've never had a complaint.  I have brought friends and family visiting from out of town and even my 70+ year old mother (who doesn't get out often) and EVERYONE has thoroughly enjoyed their food and experience here.  I always hesitate trying other Spanish Tapas Restaurants and honestly THEY NEVER MEASURE UP to Cafe Iberico!  Bravo!

Reviews.Author: s s.
Reviews.Content: We have been fans and frequent customers of Cafe Iberico since we've been in the city (years - literally) and were excited for the opportunity to have an event there on a larger scale.  We held our wedding reception on the 2nd floor of Cafe Iberico this past May and worked with Karolina (their private events coordinator) on everything from the food to the decoration.   Karolina was extremely accommodating and always made herself available to answer my many questions via phone and email.  She was able to work with my many requests including space for a band, dance floor, photobooth, dessert table etc. and the end result was an awesome party in one of our favorite restaurants in the city.  And the food?  OMG.  Really.   We basically always have a good experience there on the many dinners we've had either on our own or with friends.  But generally, since it's not a chain restaurant, the food will always have a tiny bit of difference from night to night depending on who is making it. We were amazed.  The pulpo / patatas / gambas / every item we ordered for the wedding was something that we had ordered before, and we absolutely could tell that they stepped it up a couple notches just for us. Chef himself must have been in the kitchen overseeing the event from top to bottom because the quality that day was impeccable.  It was amazing and hands down the best meal we had there by far.  My only regret was that our stomachs were too small to try all of the food we ordered, but our guests assured us that everything was a perfect 10.   Thank you Chef, Karolina, and crew!

Reviews.Author: Lea G.
Reviews.Content: terrible place! they are serving you the small tapas that seat for hours in the display and on top of it they microwave them!!! THAT IS TOTALLY GROSS!!!

Reviews.Author: Jane M.
Reviews.Content: yeah...I'm a fan!  fabulous food, great atmosphere, reasonable prices - go with a group and have a great time!
